title: Gangraped in teens, visiting courts as grandmothers: 1992 Ajmer horror is an open wound – ThePrint – Select
comments: Finally a piece of true journalism after a long time.
What are the other articles? I’m gonna push it to my reading list
The Print actually presents more centrist views and talks about topics that matter

If the police do not do their work, you can approach the senior police officers, the judge, or the MLA of that constituency. If politicians do not do their work, you can vote them out.

If judges fail to deliver, you can't go anywhere. There is no accountability in the Judiciary branch of our government. And it is better not to talk about the corruption in district and high courts. If you don't bribe the clerk, by the time your hearing comes, the court is closed. You repeat this in the next day.
